chef_bio: Rahman Mia is a renowned chef in Bangladesh with over 10 years of experience in cooking fish recipes. He is known for his unique blend of spices and cooking techniques that bring out the best flavors in fish.

recipes.ingredients: Hilsa fish, mustard paste, turmeric, salt, green chili, mustard oil
recipes.cooking_method: Marinate the fish with turmeric and salt. Fry the fish in mustard oil. In a separate pan, heat mustard oil, add mustard paste and green chili. Add water and salt to taste. Add the fried fish and cook until the sauce thickens.

recipes.ingredients: Fish fillets, mustard paste, green chili, turmeric, salt, banana leaf
recipes.cooking_method: Marinate the fish with mustard paste, turmeric, salt, and green chili. Wrap the fish in a banana leaf and steam it for 10-15 minutes.

recipes.ingredients: Prawns, coconut milk, turmeric, cumin powder, coriander powder, chili powder, salt, sugar, ghee
recipes.cooking_method: Fry the prawns in ghee. In a separate pan, heat ghee, add cumin powder, coriander powder, and chili powder. Add coconut milk, turmeric, salt, and sugar. Add the fried prawns and cook until the sauce thickens.

chef_bio: Kabir Ahmed is a master chef in Bangladesh known for his mouth-watering meat recipes. He has won several awards for his exceptional culinary skills and is a favorite among meat lovers in the country.

recipes.ingredients: Beef, onion, garlic, ginger, tomato, chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, turmeric, salt, oil
recipes.cooking_method: Heat oil in a pan. Add onion, garlic, and ginger. Add tomato and cook until soft. Add chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, turmeric, and salt. Add the beef and cook until tender.

recipes.ingredients: Mutton, rice, onion, garlic, ginger, chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, turmeric, salt, ghee
recipes.cooking_method: Marinate the mutton with chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, turmeric, salt, onion, garlic, and ginger. Cook the rice with ghee and spices. Layer the rice and mutton in a pot and cook on low heat until the meat is tender.

recipes.ingredients: Chicken, yogurt, onion, ginger, garlic, chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, cardamom, cinnamon, bay leaf, salt, oil
recipes.cooking_method: Heat oil in a pan. Add onion, ginger, garlic, cardamom, cinnamon, and bay leaf. Add chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, and salt. Add chicken and cook until tender. Add yogurt and cook for another 5-10 minutes.

chef_bio: Farhana Ahmed is a talented chef in Bangladesh specializing in vegetarian cuisine. She creates delicious and healthy recipes using fresh vegetables and traditional spices.

recipes.ingredients: Chickpeas, onion, garlic, ginger, tomato, chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, turmeric, salt, oil
recipes.cooking_method: Heat oil in a pan. Add onion, garlic, and ginger. Add tomato and cook until soft. Add chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, turmeric, and salt. Add the chickpeas and cook until tender.

recipes.ingredients: Potatoes, cauliflower, onion, garlic, ginger, chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, turmeric, salt, oil
recipes.cooking_method: Heat oil in a pan. Add onion, garlic, and ginger. Add chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, turmeric, and salt. Add potatoes and cauliflower and cook until tender.

recipes.ingredients: Eggplant, chili powder, turmeric, salt, oil
recipes.cooking_method: Slice the eggplant and sprinkle with chili powder, turmeric, and salt. Fry in oil until crispy.

chef_bio: Abdul Karim is a popular street food chef in Bangladesh. He creates unique and flavorful dishes using local ingredients and spices, and his food is loved by locals and tourists alike.

recipes.ingredients: Semolina, all-purpose flour, salt, baking soda, tamarind pulp, chickpeas, onion, chili powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, salt, water, oil
recipes.cooking_method: Mix semolina, all-purpose flour, salt, and baking soda. Add water and knead to form a dough. Roll out into small circles and fry in oil. Mix chickpeas, onion, chili powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, and salt. Fill the fried circles with the chickpea mixture and dip in tamarind pulp before eating.

recipes.ingredients: Semolina, all-purpose flour, salt, baking soda, tamarind pulp, chickpeas, onion, chili powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, salt, water, oil
recipes.cooking_method: Mix semolina, all-purpose flour, salt, and baking soda. Add water and knead to form a dough. Roll out into small circles and fry in oil. Mix chickpeas, onion, chili powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, and salt. Fill the fried circles with the chickpea mixture and dip in tamarind pulp before eating.

recipes.ingredients: Puffed rice, onion, tomato, chili powder,coriander leaves, mustard oil, salt
recipes.cooking_method: Mix puffed rice with onion, tomato, chili powder, coriander leaves, mustard oil, and salt. Serve as a snack.

chef_bio: Rahman Mia is a renowned chef in Bangladesh with over 10 years of experience in cooking fish recipes. He is known for his unique blend of spices and cooking techniques that bring out the best flavors in fish.

recipes.ingredients: Hilsa fish, mustard paste, turmeric, salt, green chili, mustard oil
recipes.cooking_method: Marinate the fish with turmeric and salt. Fry the fish in mustard oil. In a separate pan, heat mustard oil, add mustard paste and green chili. Add water and salt to taste. Add the fried fish and cook until the sauce thickens.

recipes.ingredients: Fish fillets, mustard paste, green chili, turmeric, salt, banana leaf
recipes.cooking_method: Marinate the fish with mustard paste, turmeric, salt, and green chili. Wrap the fish in a banana leaf and steam it for 10-15 minutes.

recipes.ingredients: Prawns, coconut milk, turmeric, cumin powder, coriander powder, chili powder, salt, sugar, ghee
recipes.cooking_method: Fry the prawns in ghee. In a separate pan, heat ghee, add cumin powder, coriander powder, and chili powder. Add coconut milk, turmeric, salt, and sugar. Add the fried prawns and cook until the sauce thickens.

chef_bio: Fatema Khatun is a well-known chef in Bangladesh with over 15 years of experience in cooking traditional Bangladeshi dishes. She is famous for her use of locally-sourced ingredients and traditional cooking techniques.

recipes.ingredients: Basmati rice, chicken, onion, garlic, ginger, yogurt, green chili, bay leaf, cinnamon, cardamom, cloves, ghee, salt
recipes.cooking_method: Fry sliced onion in ghee until golden brown. Add chicken and fry until brown. Add garlic, ginger, green chili, and spices. Add partially cooked basmati rice and yogurt. Add water and cook on low heat until the rice and chicken are fully cooked.

recipes.ingredients: Rice flour, jaggery, coconut, cardamom, salt
recipes.cooking_method: Mix rice flour, jaggery, grated coconut, cardamom, and salt. Make small cakes and steam them for 10-15 minutes.
Mix rice flour, grated coconut, jaggery, and salt. Make small cakes and steam them for 10-15 minutes.

recipes.ingredients: Basmati rice, lentils, onion, garlic, ginger, green chili, cumin powder, coriander powder, chili powder, turmeric, salt, ghee
recipes.cooking_method: Fry sliced onion in ghee until golden brown. Add lentils, garlic, ginger, green chili, and spices. Add partially cooked basmati rice and water. Cook on low heat until the rice and lentils are fully cooked.
